column1: Bronchi Muscle Spasm resulting from COPD
column2: 2Ts, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have what I call "episodes". its a really weird feeling I get from head to toe(anxiety maybe).  When this happens I can't seem to really catch my breath.  I feel like this 2 or 3 days a week. I have been admitted to the hospital 3 times in 4 months. I also have insomnia, depression, weight gain.

column2: Efox38, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on spiriva for 7 years.  I have moderate emphysema.  I tried to stop for one month and noticed the difference.  I question where the plastic from the capsule that is removed to allow the breathing hole goes.  I assume it would be caught in the screen, but I rarely see any there.  Is it in my lungs?  A transparent capsule to see the medication in the capsule would be a BIG improvement.

column1: Bronchi Muscle Spasm resulting from COPD
column2: cindy, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: water retention in fingers and feet

column2: Keithrhone, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking Asmanex for 5 years My new pulmonologist changed me to Spiriva two months ago. I can tell a marked improvement already. Mucus and coughing have stopped and breathing is improved. The only thing negative is constipation.

column2: LeeMisko, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I would like to know if there is a generic drug in place or ready soon - or when.Thanks.

column2: deadpidgeon, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Seems to have improved my oximeter readings. I take the reading more than once every day.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Spiriva for the last 5 months and so far I don't have much side effects except gain weight. I feel so much better now, before taking spiriva I was breathless just using stairs.

column1: Bronchi Muscle Spasm resulting from COPD
column2: 65-74 Female  (Patient)
column9: Finally, a drug that does NOT give me tremors or other serious side effects.  Been on it only four weeks....feel I can breathe more "fully" and hope to improve along with time.  Also use Qvar and rescue inhaler.  Whew....a lot of work....but life seems more eventful.

column2: DCFUK, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: helped with the breathing issues but side effects are very bad. upset stomach, dry mouth, burning feeling in the stomach.

column2: Phyllis, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After a week or so, I developed an itchy rash. After two month, the itchy rash was so severe I checked the website and discontinued using Spiriva. Now after 6 weeks of not using Spiriva, the rash is some better, but not completely gone.  What can I do for relief?  Is there a treatment that will completely stop the itchy rash?. Do you have posted experiences from others?

column2: jimE, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been of Spiriva for a week. And my breathing has almost returned to normal. iT IS VERY EFFECTIVE. However the side effects have been difficult to deal with. Experienced anxiety,dry mouth, insomnia, night sweats,depression, increased heart rate. The symptoms began almost from the start.When I stopped taking it the breathing problems returned. It will be difficut to figure out what I should do. Stop the medication or live with the side effects.

column2: Bee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Arrhythmias, severe legs cramps and shin pain +++ to point I couldn't walk with in 10 days of commencing, arm muscle pain, tetany of hands and feet by day 5, stomach pain, weakness, voice changes, paradoxical worsening of asthma, chronic cough. Symptoms have abated and all but disappeared with in 48hrs ceased.

column2: jjamesK, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: MY privary Dr. gave me a 10 pill sample of Spiriva. I noticed that after a few days my breathing improved. I then discontinued  taking it, to see the result and I had breathing problems again. I am now back on the drug. But concerned about side effects and costs.

column2: Mickey, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Using my first packet; out of 13 capsules, 3 were empty.

column1: Bronchi Muscle Spasm resulting from COPD
column2: Mike Zuchick, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I like Spiriva, but it simply cost too much and is forcing me to reconsider using it.. Shame we can not get the medication and not have to by a new Inhalator.. Anyone know if we can purchase Spiriva without the Inhalator? Just buying the Medication may keep me from falling into the Donut Hole. Maybe someone could make a suggestion for a replacement medication cause either the Spiriva or the Advair I take must go. Email is mzuchick1@triad.rr.com

column2: the thirsty one, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have "very severe" COPD and before using Spiriva I could hardly breathe. Even talking I would get out of breath. I was scared. Have been using Spriva for the past 8 months and the change in my breathing has been amazing. My lungs feel clearer, I can walk longer without losing my breath. I recommend this for anyone dealing with COPD. Its been wonderful for me! Only drawback is my mouth is so dry, my lips actually stick to my teeth. So I have something to drink with me all day. Never go anywhere without something to drink. I never knew Spriva could cause urination problems. I see others have complained of that, and it affects me too. I can go over 8 hours without having to urinate. Other than the dry mouth and problmes urinating, this is my wonder drug!

column2: 5rpns4, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: operates as described. Lasts most of the day. Appears important forever.

column2: normalee, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using Spiriva for a little over 1 month. I tried Advair first, Spiriva works better than Advair, but I still have some spasms and at times a gravelly voice. I also have some weight gain, and a very dry mouth.

column2: Trish, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Only on 17 days but seems to help with shortness of breath.  Tests showed no COPD or asthma and clear lungs but still short of breath before Spiriva.  Have to check about the empty capsules.  Never thought of that!

column2: greatgrandma, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Very expensive. Many capsules snapped and exploded when pierced.  All the powder fell out, which wasted the dose.  I do not find it helpful, but my doctor insists I take it along with another prescription.  I am considering not following his orders.

column2: lamm, 45-54 Male  (Caregiver)
column9: my husband was using spiriva, he broke out with hive and breathing got worse. dr double dose, family told us he was having bad reaction to spiriva, stop taking spiriva eye's got worse by 8 step per eye and know has myopic macular degenration. cant see cant work, ruined life

column2: sweeney, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Seems to be helpful as I appear to have increased the L/Min on my flow meter from around 500/540 to 560/600 in the month or so that I have been on it. Mouth seems dryer but that may be my Sjrogens Syndrome.One question not addressed in literature though. What happens to the piece of the capsule coating that is removed when capsule is punctured? Is it gelatin and gradually absorbed somewhere safe? would be nice to know I've only found remains of the capsue once in the unit into which the capsules are inserted. Agree with suggestion of clear capsule as I did find at first that not all powder had been inhaled. Now breath in at least twice and then check all has gone

column2: oregongal, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've been using Spiriva along with Advair, and Albuterol inhaler. I had major side effects I believe were caused by the Advair. Weight gain, water retention, headaches, shortness of breath, and terrible dry skin! I was put on water pills and that was a disaster! The Advair was stopped and I was given Dulera. Its a fantastic drug, however in the U.S. its $240.00 for (1) inhaler. I'm forced to purchase from Canada because I don't have have insurance. Even in Canada, the Dulera is very expensive until the patent runs out. I still don't know which of the (3) meds is causing the dry skin, (dermatitis). Any ideas??

column2: izabela, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: spriva handi haler

column2: JUDYLS41@AOL.COM, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I WAS PRESCRIBED SPIRIVA TO PREVENT ANY FURTHER PROGRESSION OF COPD. DONT NOTICE ANY DIFFERENCE IN MY BREATHING, I AM A LUNG CANCER SURVIVOR WITH 2/3 OF RIGHT LUNG REMOVED. I GET GENERIC SPIRIVA FROM canada generic.com for $ 50 INCLUDING SHIPPING FOR A THREE NONTHS SUPPLY. THIS PAST WEEK I HAVE HAD SWELLING OF FEET AND ANKLES AND WILL HAVE ULTRA SOUND, IT IS POSSIBLE SIDE EFFECT OF SPIRIVA. HAVING ULTRA SOUND TEST SO SEE WHAT IS CAUSING SWELLING.  GOOD HEALTH TO ALL.

column2: 65-74 Female  (Patient)
column9: NA

column2: billyvig1@yahoo.com, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

column2: 65-74 Female  (Patient)
tieka, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I went on this medication after Advair stopped working and trying about 8 other asthma medications.  All others made my heart race.  This one seems to elevate my pulse which wakes me up at about 4am every morning.  If I do sleep longer I can not sleep more than 7 hours at a time.  I have had a skin issue while on Spiriva where I get red marks for a few days if I press against an object for longer than 15 minutes.  The red marks last about 2 days.  Both sleeplessness and skin issues dissappear when I stopped taking Spiriva for 2 days.  Other than that it does help me breath better with less racing heart issues.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I know this may be jumping the gun, but the improvement with this drug, at least for me, was evident after my first dose. I have been diagnosed with severe emphysema (after 35 years of smoking, ya think? :) ), and experienced shortness of breath after something as simple as showering. After the first dose, I noticed that I went thru the entire day sympton free. As for side effects, I don't believe I've been on it long enough for any to really develop, but I thank the posters here for things to be on the lookout for.

column2: tamg143@aol.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First day using it and my lungs are on fire and I can't breath.

column2: ark867@aol.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: jeannotcompany, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Back in the winter my doctor put me on this inhaler to ease my breathing discomfort. After 3 weeks I developed a very soar throat with some bleeding through the sinus cavities and lost my vocals for up to 5 weeks. Could not carry on a conversation with anyone. I am dispointed with my doctor for not pointing that out to me even if the side effects may have been listed on the package insert. Too bad too because the medicine was helping me gain breathing momentum as I always had trouble climbing stairs. The medicine gave me the energy to do just that. But I have a business that requires engaging people on a daily basis and my inability to speak was not a good thing so I got off of Spiriva.

column2: pararex, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I Have Been a COPD Sufferer For The Last 6 Years.  I see where others have posted that Spiriva did not help them.  Spiriva does not act overnite.  I Would Say Give It About 3-6 Months For 100% relief.  It Has Helped Me & Probably Saved My Airways From Closing.  I Do hope Everyone Give It A Reasonable Time Length To Be effective.

column2: seaweed, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have asthma and for the last 8 years have had problems walking any distance or doing any exercise.  I started taking singlair about a year ago and that helped some but now I am Spiriva and for me it is a miracle drug.  I can walk, work, exerice and have very little problem breathing.  I have never been diagnosed with COPD and have been tested twice in the past four years.  The only side affect I am having is the dry mouth but I can deal with that to be able to breath normally.

column2: Nora,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: been taking for over 1 year...have noticed some ease in breathing problems, nothing much to brag about. This drug is not cheap to start with, and then not have a full 30 days worth sucks. I don't know who to complain to in regard to this issue.

column2: jewelt, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i've used spiriva for a few yrs. now and had good results.last year head aches,eye pain w/itching, and blured vision started. my vision is getting worse so i'm taking myself off to see if problems stop.

column2: 65-74 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have COPD, emphysema, and have been onspiriva for one year. It has greatly helpedwith my breathing and only side effect isslight head ache sometimes. Very good drug.

column2: Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I 59 and smoked 42 years; diagnosed with COPD two years ago, confirmed by lung specialist 4 months ago, started Spiriva 3 months ago.I am able to breathe much better, and much more deeply and effectively. I cycle 80-100 miles a week.  Hills that were a major effort before Spiriva are nowhere nearly as daunting. My overall energy level is much increased.I have had no side effects other than slight hoarseness.I highly recommend that COPD patients try the drug to see if it works for them.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The inhalation treatment is easy to use. The packaging is not very fun at times. I have also received a few pills that were empty. The pill is effective for reducing mucous. I have had chronic asthma.

column2: Barb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with Mod. COPD. Been on this med. for 5 days, no improvement. The only thing it has given me are heart palpitations.  I'm on Symbicort as well. I love riding my bike (10+ miles per day), but the COPD restricts that now. Spiriva/Symbicort combo is worthless.  I have more mucous and chest tightness now than before I started these meds. I'm an ex-smoker (2 1/2 packs - 31 years); quit 12 years ago. Doc says I've probably had COPD for many years, the symptoms are just now surfacing.  Chest x-ray clear, lungs clear. Spiro test revealed that I have 62% lung function. I have bad allergies and am wondering if that's not most of the problem.  I'm going for a 2nd opinion.

column2: TahoHugh, 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

But if my doctor still wants me to use it I will, but some of the side effects cause me distress, even though this medication really helps me every day, and I was diagnosed at 53 years old.

I live in the northeast, heat with oil, and keep my thermostat at 60 degrees. If I really need to keep this medication at 77, that's a huge hidden cost.

column2: Patricia, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have mild to moderate asthma and reactive airway disease. For years I have had a chronic cough and have used every inhaler and medication for allergies that is available OTC or by prescription.  I frequently used an albuteral inhaler to stop sudden coughing attacks. A year ago I was prescribed Spiriva and it has been a miracle for me! I rarely have sporatic coughing attacks (especially in public) and rarely use an albuteral inhaler--before that I used it almost daily. I am so grateful that my new allergist realized that this is the drug of choice for me. I take no other medications for my condition.

column2: 45-54 Male  (Patient)
column9: My doc gave me the Spiriva because of my smoking. The first time I used it, I noticed a drastic change in my lung capacity for the GOOD. I'm able to take deeper breaths and hold my breath longer. I play racquet ball every day and I am not huffing and puffing half as much as I normally do. I have been using the drug for one week but I am amazed. Also, in the week I have been using it, I have cut my smoking down by at least 50% for some reason????

column9: I've been thinking everything was fine.  The drug appears to work quite well.  Today, though, I went to my eye doctor and he told me I am beginning to experience signs of macular degeneration.  I am only 55.  I have been on Spiriva for one year and nine months and it has been almost exactly two years since my last eye appt.  I had noticed problems with my eyesight and I had read that one could experience changes in vision with this drug.  Has anyone else out there had any such diagnoses?

column2: Diana,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years

column2: AnnMc2323, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Once you figure out how to use the inhaler and capsules correctly, it is easy to use.  However, it is not possible to just buy the capsules alone.  One presciption includes only 30 caspules which is a one month supply if taken as directed. So you are paying a lot for a new inhaler you probably do not need.  I wish they would just sell the capsules in lots of 60 per prescription.  I do not like having to pay for a new inhaler and then getting only 30 capsules per box.  This is not a cheap drug - roughly $150 per box and you get only a one month supply or 30 capsules.  As directed, you are supposed to take it every day at the same time.  This drug is way too expensive. Ask your doctor for something less expensive if your medical condition allows it.

column2: dbacarisse@aol.com, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Increased risk of a Stroke using Spiriva.The FDA released a statement on 3/18/08 that Tiotropium (marketed as Spiriva HandiHaler)    Audience: Pulmonary care health professionals and patients    [Posted 03/18/2008] Boehringer Ingelheim and FDA notified healthcare professionals that ongoing safety monitoring has identified a possible increased risk of stroke in patients who take Spiriva.  I suggest that you contact your Physician immediately as I am doing.This is the FDA webpage that discusses this problem.  http://www.fda.gov/medwatch/safety/2008/safet y08.htm#Tiotropium

column2: starion, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It's MUCH more convenient than taking Atrovent multiple times/day & I've been taking it daily since shortly after FDA approval in 2004.Very effective, long-lasting med which is helpful for COPD patients especially.  Side effects are pretty mild (at least for me).  It may be causing slightly elevated resting heart rate, but otherwise haven't noticed side effects as long as I take it in the morning (believe it might keep me awake if I took it in the evening instead).Have suggested they make the capsule fully or partly clear so patients can see the powder in the capsule before they take their med & no powder after they've taken their med.  BI (manufacturer) says they'll consider the suggestion, which has been implemented in some other countries.
